alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 04 at 2:29PM AKST until January 06 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 75 below expected along the Yukon River near Eagle. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Along the Yukon River near Eagle. * WHEN...6 PM this evening to 6 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds along the Yukon River are expected to develop this evening and continue into Thursday morning. These winds will cause dangerously cold wind chills that are expected to last into Thursday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
